## PERSONAL ACCIDENT

### Section 6. Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement

If You have suffered an Injury, which within twelve (12) months of its happening is the sole cause of Your Death or Permanent Disablement, We will pay You the relevant percentage as set out in the Scale of Compensation, up to the Benefit Limit as specified in the Policy Schedule.

### Scale of Compensation
questions: How does the policy define the time frame within which death or permanent disablement must occur following an injury to qualify for Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement benefits, and what documentation is required to prove the injury and its consequences?

In the event of an injury leading to permanent disablement, how is the relevant percentage of compensation determined according to the Scale of Compensation, and how does this interact with the overall Benefit Limit specified in the Policy Schedule?

What conditions must be met for the injury to be considered the sole cause of death or permanent disablement under the Personal Accident section, and how might pre-existing conditions or other contributing factors affect claim eligibility?
How does the policy handle cases where death or permanent disablement occurs after the twelve-month period following the injury, and are there any exceptions or extensions to this time limit?

If an insured person suffers multiple injuries during the trip, how does the policy determine which injury is the sole cause of death or permanent disablement for the purpose of compensation under Section 6?

What are the implications of the Benefit Limit specified in the Policy Schedule on the maximum payout for Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement, and how does this limit interact with the Scale of Compensation percentages?
How does the policy address claims where the injury results in partial permanent disablement, and what documentation or medical assessments are required to establish the degree of disablement?

Are there any exclusions or general policy conditions that override or limit the Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement benefits, such as injuries resulting from hazardous activities or non-accidental causes?
How does the policy define 'Injury' in the context of Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement, and what types of incidents or events qualify as covered injuries?
In cases where the insured dies within twelve months but from causes unrelated to the injury, how does the policy determine claim eligibility for Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement benefits?

What is the process and required timing for notifying the insurer of an injury that may lead to a claim under the Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement section, and how does late notification affect claim outcomes?

How does the policy handle claims involving insured persons under different age groups, and are there any age-related limitations or conditions affecting Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement coverage?

If the injury occurs during a trip but the death or permanent disablement happens after returning home, how does the policy address the location and timing of the event in relation to coverage eligibility?
How does the policy treat cases where the injury leads to temporary disablement before permanent disablement is confirmed, and is there any coverage for temporary disablement under this section?
What role does the Scale of Compensation play in determining payouts for different types of permanent disablement, and how are complex cases involving multiple disabilities assessed?
Are there any requirements for medical examinations or independent assessments to verify the extent of permanent disablement before compensation is paid under this section?
How does the policy interact with other sections or optional covers when an injury leads to both medical expenses and Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement claims?

In the event of a claim, what documentation must be submitted to prove that the injury was the sole cause of death or permanent disablement, and how does the insurer verify the authenticity of such documents?

How does the policy address situations where the injury was sustained during activities excluded under general policy exclusions, and what impact does this have on Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement claims?

What are the implications of the twelve-month limitation period on ongoing medical treatment or rehabilitation related to the injury, and does the policy provide any automatic extensions or exceptions for delayed onset of permanent disablement?
